qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: As an emerging business model, software-as-a-service (SaaS) has proliferated over the past decade and there are signs to suggest that this growth is likely to continue or even accelerate in the near future
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes proliferation with expectations for continued/accelerated growth, indicating growing model with future potential.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Clarifying the Value Elements of Business Models for Disturbance Management in Supply Chains
qualitative_analysis.quote: The service is new and the company does not yet have a specific business model related to the service, e.g. the cost structure and revenue streams are still under consideration
qualitative_analysis.justification: States business model still under consideration, indicating very early emerging stage.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The Impact of Open Source Software Commercialization on Firm Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: Vendors of proprietary software products are increasingly moving to business models inspired by open source software (OSS)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes increasing vendor transition to OSS-inspired models, indicating growing adoption.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The relationship between Open Innovation and Strategy
qualitative_analysis.quote: Open Innovation (OI) has gained growing importance
qualitative_analysis.justification: States Open Innovation gaining importance, indicating growing adoption and maturity.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open-Source Software Entrepreneurial Business Modelling
qualitative_analysis.quote: We are currently in this process of testing how the tool can best be applied by entrepreneurs
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes tool still in testing process, indicating emerging development for startup application.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Towards a better Understanding of the Dynamics of Platform as a Service Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Platform as a Service (PaaS) solutions are changing the way software is produced, distributed, used, and priced
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes PaaS changing fundamental aspects of software business, indicating growing transformative impact.
